009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
015import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
016
017/**
018 * <p>
019 * Vector version (applicable to ColorProcessor only) of a Kuwahara-type filter, 
020 * similar to the filter described in [1]. 
021 * It structures the filter region into five overlapping, 
022 * square subregions (including a center region) of size (r+1) x (r+1). 
023 * See Sec. 17.1 of [2] for additional details.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * [1] F. Tomita and S. Tsuji. Extraction of multiple regions by smoothing
027 * in selected neighborhoods. IEEE Transactions on Systems, Man,
028 * and Cybernetics 7, 394â€“407 (1977).
029 * <br>
030 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 
031 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
032 * </p>
033 * 
034 * @author W. Burger
035 * @version 2021/01/02
036 */
037public class KuwaharaFilterVector extends GenericFilterVector implements KuwaharaF {
038        
039        private final int n;                    // fixed subregion size 
040        private final int dm;                   // = d-
041        private final int dp;                   // = d+
042        private final float tsigma;
043
044        // constructor using default settings
045        public KuwaharaFilterVector() {
046                this(new Parameters());
047        }
048        
049        public KuwaharaFilterVector(Parameters params) {
050                int r = params.radius;
051                this.n = sqr(r + 1);    // size of complete filter
052                this.dm = (r / 2) - r;                  // d- = top/left center coordinate
053                this.dp = this.dm + r;                  // d+ = bottom/right center coordinate
054                this.tsigma = (float)params.tsigma;
055        }
056        
057        // ------------------------------------------------------
058
059        private float Smin;             // min. variance
060        private final float[] Amin = new float[3];
061        private final float[] rgb = new float[3];
062        
063
064        @Override
065        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v)  {
066                Smin = Float.MAX_VALUE;
067                evalSubregion(pack, u, v);                              // centered subregion - different to original Kuwahara!
068                Smin = Smin - 3 * tsigma * n;                           // tS * n because we use variance scaled by n
069                evalSubregion(pack, u + dm, v + dm);
070                evalSubregion(pack, u + dm, v + dp);
071                evalSubregion(pack, u + dp, v + dm);
072                evalSubregion(pack, u + dp, v + dp);
073                this.copyPixel(Amin, rgb);
074                return rgb;
075        } 
076        
077        private void evalSubregion(PixelPack source, int u, int v) {
078                // evaluate the subregion centered at (u,v)
079                final float[] S1 = new float[3];        // sum of pixel values
080                final float[] S2 = new float[3];        // sum of squared pixel values
081                for (int j = dm; j <= dp; j++) {
082                        for (int i = dm; i <= dp; i++) {                
083                                float[] cp = source.getPix(u + i, v + j);
084
085                                S1[0] = S1[0] + cp[0];
086                                S1[1] = S1[1] + cp[1];
087                                S1[2] = S1[2] + cp[2];
088                                
089                                S2[0] = S2[0] + sqr(cp[0]);
090                                S2[1] = S2[1] + sqr(cp[1]);
091                                S2[2] = S2[2] + sqr(cp[2]);
092                        }
093                }
094                // calculate the variance for this subregion:
095//              S[0] = S2[0] - S1[0] * S1[0] / n;
096//              S[1] = S2[1] - S1[1] * S1[1] / n;
097//              S[2] = S2[2] - S1[2] * S1[2] / n;
098                // total variance (scaled by n):
099//              float Srgb = S[0] + S[1] + S[2];
100                float Srgb = (S2[0] - sqr(S1[0]) + S2[1] - sqr(S1[1]) + S2[2] - sqr(S1[2])) / n;
101                if (Srgb < Smin) { 
102                        Smin = Srgb;
103                        Amin[0] = S1[0] / n;
104                        Amin[1] = S1[1] / n;
105                        Amin[2] = S1[2] / n;
106                }
107        }
108
109}
